comment.author: 70251312@N00
60894293@N00
comment._content:
Atlanta Constitution - March 13, 1914

ON BENTON'S SLAYER CARRANZA IS CLOSING

...................................
It is said also that the commission has gathered evidence that Colonel Fidel Avila, commanding the garrison of Juarez, ordered the execution of Gustav Bauch, a German-American, who was tried as a spy, but in whose case no verdict was rendered. Rebel officers at Juarez and at Chihuahua repeatedly have denied that he was killed.

(An article in the Constituion on March 19 states that he was a railroad mechanic.)

comment.author: 60894293@N00
comment._content:
Washington Post - March 15, 1914

............................That Gustav Bauch, the American, was executed by Pancho Villa at Juarez was declared yesterday before the House foreign affairs committee by El Frego Baca, of Albuquerque, N. Mex., once a candidate for Congress..........................

comment.author: 60894293@N00
comment._content: The San Antonio Light for December 14, 1947 lists an obituary for Gustav F. Bauch, 59, of 838 Gramercy Place.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thank you all for your additional information on Gustav Bauch.  We will add some of it to the record when we update the database.
